data.title: 'The PM is not under a desk': Penny Mordaunt forced to defend Liz Truss's absence – video
data.meta_description: Labour MP Stella Creasy told the house: 'For all we know the PM is hiding under a desk' after Liz Truss appointed Penny Mordaunt to deputise for her during an urgent question in the Commons
data.text:
This article is more than 1 year old

In a bizarre exchange during an urgent question, brought to the House of Commons by Keir Starmer, Penny Mordaunt was forced to defend the absence of Liz Truss, who was unable to make it to the dispatch box in time. Labour MP Stella Creasy said: 'For all we know, the prime minister is hiding under a desk' after Mordaunt informed the chamber that the PM had urgent business to attend to

Jeremy Hunt shreds Truss’s economic plans in astounding U-turn on tax

Liz Truss admits ‘mistakes have been made’ as Jeremy Hunt says ‘eye-watering’ decisions on tax and spending need to be made – live
